issue.body:
New type of YouTube ads is blocked by our filters. If that does not help, try using our script by following the instructions below.

---

Please enable AdGuard Extra in AdGuard settings (for app users).

---

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.title: Tracking domains
issue.body:
Hello!
There is a site called iplogger.com that allows you to create and insert a tracking pixel into any email (or even a website).

Here is a link to this service:
https://iplogger.org/tracking-pixel/

In the end, the links will look something like this:

```
iplogger[.]com/1V8mH4.jpg
iplogger[.]org/1V8mH4.jpg
iplogger[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
iplogger[.]co/1V8mH4.jpg
iplogger[.]info/1V8mH4.jpg
mapper[.]info/1V8mH4.jpg
2no[.]co/1V8mH4.jpg
yip[.]su/1V8mH4.jpg
iplogger[.]com/1V8mH4.jpg
ipgraber[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
ipgrabber[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
iplis[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
02ip[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
ezstat[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
wl[.]gl/1V8mH4.jpg
ed[.]tk/1V8mH4.jpg
bc[.]ax/1V8mH4.jpg
```

**So I suggest you the following rules:**
```
||iplogger.com^$third-party
||iplogger.org^$third-party
||iplogger.ru^$third-party
||iplogger.co^$third-party
||iplogger.info^$third-party
||mapper.info^$third-party
||2no.co^$third-party
||yip.su^$third-party
||iplogger.com^$third-party
||ipgraber.ru^$third-party
||ipgrabber.ru^$third-party
||iplis.ru^$third-party
||02ip.ru^$third-party
||ezstat.ru^$third-party
||wl.gl^$third-party
||ed.tk^$third-party
||bc.ax^$third-party
```

issue.title: What did you developers do?

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.4

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://gaypornhdfree.com/?ref=mygaysites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
Quick reminder if you want me to stop making issue tickets than stop not responding anymore on the ones already made again I am paying for AdGuard so I don’t understand why I have to make multiple issue tickets just to get a response now with that out of the way 

Okay, so I’m gonna try this way you all seem to be having no issue Alex, BlazDT, Zolyden,yougotskinny, and Krystian watching multiple videos on gaypornhdfree.com with your AdGuard active so clearly the issue is not with Adguard than it’s either with my phone, my internet provider, internet protocol, or I just didn’t follow the steps exactly and or in the correct order 

So please thoroughly explain the step by step process and the order of the process you did to accomplish Adguard never being detected when trying to play videos on gaypornhdfree.com

if I can determine with your help that I have now with confirmation followed the steps to the letter that you all followed to accomplish this,

than I can check this one off and realize it’s an issue with my phone, internet provider, or my internet protocol, 

but I want know unless one of you explains thoroughly what you did of step by step and the order to make gaypornhdfree.com never detect AdGuard each time, 


So please respond as asap with the detailed instructions of what you did 
2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
> Limit could be extended, but Op states he currently only has two lists active. iOS sadly treats iframe's requests as the main page, so every rule which targets iframe must be applied to main page too (for iOS)

I have deleted the three old user rules you wanted me to add, and I have now added the five new ones you just commented. I did them one by one, waited for the gray bar at the bottom of the app (rules are being converted, etc.) to disappear. I then went to the home menu of the app, and clicked the updating button. I did the same process for the other four. Some had updates, some didn't. For each one, the video was still broken.

issue.title: kledgeb.blogspot.com

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

Реклама блокируется через раз. Пробовал вчера включить различные фильтры, использовать приватный dns, включать/отключать экспериментальные настройки сафари, и все без толку. При открытии любого отзыва на отзовике может остаться реклама. При обновлении страницы она исчезает, но в 2 из 5 случаев появляется вновь ### Screenshots

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
I have uninstalled and reinstalled the Adguard app multiple times could doing that interfere with getting updates? Or could that cause the base filter that Alex added a new code specifically for gaypornhdfree.com to no longer work? My iPhone is iPhone 7 Plus operating system 15.7.1 safari version 15.7.1

All I know is now if I click the updating button on the adguard app it saids no updates found. And the website is now detecting my adblocker every time no matter how many refreshes of the page I do. Could someone also please tell me what are the exact filters I must have enabled for in safari protection of the app in order for the added code Alex did to work? 

I have set up the six Adguard extensions on settings-safari of Aduard custom-Adguard general-Aduard other-Adguard privacy-Adguard security-Adguard-social 

each one is enabled 

I have gone to gaypornhdfree.com selected the aA icon on the left of the url bar of safari picked manage extensions and made sure adguard was enabled for advanced protection

I also clicked on adguard on the list shown when you click aA and checked to make sure safari protection specifically for that website is enabled

I have went also to setting-safari and selected

delete history and website data I have also selected close tabs afterwards 


I have added the user rule that Alex told me to add I have done everything I believe I was told of the exact order

but just in case could someone please direct me to the steps again of the exact order 

to make sure I have not missed a step or done it in the wrong order

comment.body:
> If issue sometimes occurs and sometimes not, then I guess that it might be iOS/Safari related issue where some rules are applied too late and due to this don't work.
For example, similar issue was here - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/108226#issuecomment-1098870812 on every other platforms popups were blocked correctly, but on iOS (the same with Safari extension) sometimes were blocked, sometimes not, and it looks like iOS/Safari extensions issue.

I agree with that. Looks like it can be related to https://github.com/AdguardTeam/SafariConverterLib/issues/40 and we can only wait for the fix.

issue.title: Tracking domains

labels.name: Stale
labels.description: The issue is considered as obsolete

issue.body:
Hello!
There is a site called iplogger.com that allows you to create and insert a tracking pixel into any email (or even a website).

Here is a link to this service:
https://iplogger.org/tracking-pixel/

In the end, the links will look something like this:

```
iplogger[.]com/1V8mH4.jpg
iplogger[.]org/1V8mH4.jpg
iplogger[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
iplogger[.]co/1V8mH4.jpg
iplogger[.]info/1V8mH4.jpg
mapper[.]info/1V8mH4.jpg
2no[.]co/1V8mH4.jpg
yip[.]su/1V8mH4.jpg
iplogger[.]com/1V8mH4.jpg
ipgraber[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
ipgrabber[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
iplis[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
02ip[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
ezstat[.]ru/1V8mH4.jpg
wl[.]gl/1V8mH4.jpg
ed[.]tk/1V8mH4.jpg
bc[.]ax/1V8mH4.jpg
```

**So I suggest you the following rules:**
```
||iplogger.com^$third-party
||iplogger.org^$third-party
||iplogger.ru^$third-party
||iplogger.co^$third-party
||iplogger.info^$third-party
||mapper.info^$third-party
||2no.co^$third-party
||yip.su^$third-party
||iplogger.com^$third-party
||ipgraber.ru^$third-party
||ipgrabber.ru^$third-party
||iplis.ru^$third-party
||02ip.ru^$third-party
||ezstat.ru^$third-party
||wl.gl^$third-party
||ed.tk^$third-party
||bc.ax^$third-party
```

comment.body:
This is caused by `Dandelion Sprout's Annoyances List`
Please add to user rules: `rotter.net#@#p:has-text(/^ $/):not(:has-text(/\S/)):not(:-abp-has(img, input, iframe))`

Obviously I cannot adjust rules or update filters for this service, as it does not operate in that way, but is entirely controlled by the AdGuard team on their-side. comment.body:
I can reproduce it with version 4.1.52 in Chrome and it looks like that it's related to this issue - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/Scriptlets/issues/268
Adding:
```adblock
cafe.naver.com#@%#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'document.body.oncopy', 'null')
```
to user rules should fixes this issue.

comment.body:
It seems that it is related to [the ReDoS accident](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/2240) of List-KR filter.
It is resolved by removing the regex rule causing the issue.

Please update your filters by clicking update button in the main menu.
If AdGuard Browser Extension stops working, please reinstall AdGuard Browser Extension.

<details>
<summary>Korean - 한국어</summary>

List-KR 필터의 ReDoS 사고와 관련되어 있는 것으로 보입니다.
문제를 발생시키는 정규 표현식을 제거하여 해결되었습니다.

메인 메뉴에 있는 업데이트버튼을 눌러 필터를 업데이트해주세요.
만약 AdGuard 브라우저 확장 프로그램이 작동을 멈춘다면, AdGuard 브라우저 확장을 재설치해주세요.

</details>

### Prerequisites

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.4

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://gaypornhdfree.com/?ref=mygaysites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
I have uninstalled and reinstalled the Adguard app multiple times could doing that interfere with getting updates? Or could that cause the base filter that Alex added a new code specifically for gaypornhdfree.com to no longer work? My iPhone is iPhone 7 Plus operating system 15.7.1 safari version 15.7.1

All I know is now if I click the updating button on the adguard app it saids no updates found. And the website is now detecting my adblocker every time no matter how many refreshes of the page I do. Could someone also please tell me what are the exact filters I must have enabled for in safari protection of the app in order for the added code Alex did to work? 

I have set up the six Adguard extensions on settings-safari of Aduard custom-Adguard general-Aduard other-Adguard privacy-Adguard security-Adguard-social 

each one is enabled 

I have gone to gaypornhdfree.com selected the aA icon on the left of the url bar of safari picked manage extensions and made sure adguard was enabled for advanced protection

I also clicked on adguard on the list shown when you click aA and checked to make sure safari protection specifically for that website is enabled

I have went also to setting-safari and selected

delete history and website data I have also selected close tabs afterwards 


I have added the user rule that Alex told me to add I have done everything I believe I was told of the exact order

but just in case could someone please direct me to the steps again of the exact order 

to make sure I have not missed a step or done it in the wrong order





2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

If someone could please respond of the exact order of the steps needed for this to work I could implement then immediately 


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
> > @AdamWr `@zloyden` can you reproduce on that dood.re iframe page?
> 
> Unfortunately, I cannot reproduce it.
> 
> If issue sometimes occurs and sometimes not, then I guess that it might be iOS/Safari related issue where some rules are applied too late and due to this don't work. For example, similar issue was here - [#108226 (comment)](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/108226#issuecomment-1098870812) on every other platforms popups were blocked correctly, but on iOS (the same with Safari extension) sometimes were blocked, sometimes not, and it looks like iOS/Safari extensions issue.

But BlazDT has an iPhone and was using safari I believe which worked perfectly for him!

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-download/windowsinsiderpreviewiso?wa=wsignin1.0](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fsoftware-download%2Fwindowsinsiderpreviewiso%3Fwa%3Dwsignin1.0) ### Comment > When AdGuard Public DNS (https://dns.adguard-dns.com/dns-query) is enabled, it is not possible to download ISO images from the Windows Insider Preview ISO website. Only by disabling Secure DNS in the browser does the site then work. Obviously I cannot adjust rules or update filters for this service, as it does not operate in that way, but is entirely controlled by the AdGuard team on their-side. (I have the AdGuard Browser Extension fully-disabled for this website, however, so that won't be affecting anything.) ### Screenshots

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

4.4.4

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

Safari

Mobile

https://gaypornhdfree.com/?ref=mygaysites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
Quick reminder if you want me to stop making issue tickets than stop not responding anymore on the ones already made again I am paying for AdGuard so I don’t understand why I have to make multiple issue tickets just to get a response now with that out of the way 

Okay, so I’m gonna try this way you all seem to be having no issue Alex, BlazDT, Zolyden,yougotskinny, and Krystian watching multiple videos on gaypornhdfree.com with your AdGuard active so clearly the issue is not with Adguard than it’s either with my phone, my internet provider, internet protocol, or I just didn’t follow the steps exactly and or in the correct order 

So please thoroughly explain the step by step process and the order of the process you did to accomplish Adguard never being detected when trying to play videos on gaypornhdfree.com

if I can determine with your help that I have now with confirmation followed the steps to the letter that you all followed to accomplish this,

than I can check this one off and realize it’s an issue with my phone, internet provider, or my internet protocol, 

but I want know unless one of you explains thoroughly what you did of step by step and the order to make gaypornhdfree.com never detect AdGuard each time, 


So please respond as asap with the detailed instructions of what you did

comment.body:
Szczerze mówiąc nie wiem czemu tak się dzieje, bo u mnie zarówno w Chrome jak i w Safari reklamy są zablokowane.
Spróbuj proszę wyłączyć część list filtrów (rozszerzenia do Safari obsługują ograniczoną liczbę reguł i przekroczenie tego limitu powoduje, że część reguł zostaje wyłączona), na przykład `EasyList` (`AdGuard Base` zawiera reguły z tej listy), `AdGuard Mobile Ads`, dodatkowo w celach testowych `EasyPrivacy`, `Peter Lowe's Blocklist` i `Adblock Warning Removal List`.
Potem zaktualizuj filtry (poczekaj około 30-60 sekund żeby zmiany zostały zastosowane) i sprawdź proszę ponownie.

Możesz też w celach testowych dodać tę regułę:
```adblock
wp.pl#%#alert('Test');
```
do reguł użytkownika.
Powinno pojawić się okienko z komunikatem `Test`, jeśli się nie pojawia, to z jakiegoś powodu reguły zaawansowane nie działają.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.nytimes.com/2022/12/15/health/covid-dead-bodies.html](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2022%2F12%2F15%2Fhealth%2Fcovid-dead-bodies.html) ### Comment > The NYTimes has a pop up asking if I want to use their app. On Safari for iOS, this grays out the screen, but is still scrollable. I can make a AdGuard user rule to hide the gray by selecting anywhere. Ever since NYT has implemented this pop up a month ago, it has made it nearly impossible to use with or without ad guard. issue.title: Rules clean up
issue.body:
Hello!
In the rules located [here](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/SpywareFilter/sections/tracking_servers.txt) the same rule is stated twice. Once it is commented, the second time - not.

I suggest removing the commented version.

**Here is commented version (line 10):**
![A1C90660-4FB7-49D0-91EF-CAE12E006FAA](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/120200229/206930873-3f0c16e5-ed5e-41ed-8772-ed411fecf9da.jpeg)

**And here is not (line 55):**
![C49EFF0F-086A-4FE9-9990-F51A2581C9D4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/120200229/206930882-3ab5fffe-1f37-4627-9972-515dd615f2f6.jpeg)

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
